intro: Absinthium spicatum, commonly known as goat's beard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, spiky leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Absinthium spicatum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has historical uses in traditional medicine.

It is also found in parts of North Africa, including Morocco and Algeria. This plant thrives in dry, sunny environments and is commonly found in rocky or sandy soils. It is often associated with Mediterranean climates and can be seen in grasslands and open woodlands. Its native range extends into the Iberian Peninsula and the western parts of the Balkan Peninsula.
